methods.name: iCheckRows

returnValue.description: The result of the {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#waitFor} function, that can be used for chaining statements

parameters.name: mRowValues
iExpectedNumberOfRows
parameters.description: The expected number of rows considering mRowValues and mRowState

parameters.name: mState
parameters.description: Defines the expected state of the target row

methods.description: Checks the rows of a table. If mRowValues is provided, only rows with the corresponding values are considered. If iNumberOfRows is provided, the number of rows are checked with respect to the provided mRowValues (if set) or in total. If iNumberOfRows is omitted, it checks for at least one matching row. If mState is provided, the row must be in the given state.

returnValue.description: The result of the {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#waitFor} function, to be used for chained statements

parameters.name: vFieldIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the field

parameters.description: Defines the expected state of the adaptation filter field

parameters.name: vActions
parameters.description: The actions to be executed on found adaptation field

parameters.name: sDescription
parameters.description: The description of the check or adaptation

methods.description: Helper method to adapt filter fields. If no actions are given, this function can be used for checking only. During execution it checks for an already open adaptation popover. If it does not exist, it is opened before the check/interaction of the filter fields, and closed directly afterwards.

methods.name: iCheckBreadCrumb

returnValue.description: The result of the {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#waitFor} function, to be used for chained statements

parameters.name: sLink
parameters.description: The text property of the link to be tested. The links aggregation of the breadcrumb control is checked for the availability of the given text. If sLink is provided as an empty string, a check is executed to see whether the breadcrumb control exists and has an empty links aggregation. This is the case for the main object page, which does not show breadcrumb links. If sLink is not provided, a check is executed to ensure the breadcrumb control does not exist at all. This is the case for the flexible column layout showing multiple floorplans at the same time.

methods.description:
Checks a specific breadcrumb link on the object page.

methods.description: Checks the rows of a table. If mRowValues is provided, only rows with the corresponding values are considered. If iNumberOfRows is provided, the number of rows are checked with respect to the provided mRowValues (if set) or in total. If iNumberOfRows is omitted, it checks for at least one matching row. If mState is provided, the row must be in the given state.

parameters.name: mSettings

launchUrl.description: The URL to the launching page (usually a FLP.html)

async.name: async
async.description: If false (default), only one JourneyRunner is executed at a time

parameters.description: The settings object for the tests to run. Overrides instance settings

parameters.name: _vJourneys
parameters.description:
The journeys to be executed. If a journey is represented as a string, it will be interpreted as a module path to the file that should be loaded. Else it is expected to be a function. Alternatively, instead of being wrapped in an array, the journeys can also be given as separate parameters: 
.run(mSettings, Journey1, Journey2, ...)

methods.description:
Executes the journeys in the given order.

The settings provided as first parameter are merged into the base settings of the JourneyRunner instance.

methods.name: run
methods.description:
Static function to run the default runner with given parameters. Shortcut for 
JourneyRunner.getDefaultRunner().run(mSettings, Journey1, Journey2, ...)
See {@link sap.fe.test.JourneyRunner#run} for parameter details.
